How to Use Monvvo Loan Amortization Calculator

  1. Enter the Principal Amount.
    Provide the total sum of money you are borrowing. This amount is necessary for the loan amortization calculator to determine your payment schedule.
  2. Input the Annual Interest Rate.
    Specify the annual interest rate for the loan. This rate influences the total interest you’ll pay over the loan term and is crucial for accurate calculations with the loan amortization calculator.
  3. Specify the Loan Term.
    Indicate the length of time over which you will repay the loan, expressed in months. This helps the loan amortization calculator estimate your monthly payment amount.
  4. Choose the Payment Frequency.
    Select how often you will make payments, such as annually, semi-annually, quarterly, bi-monthly, monthly, bi-weekly, or weekly. This helps the loan amortization calculator determine your payment schedule.
  5. Enter the Loan Start Date.
    Provide the date when you begin making loan payments. This helps the loan amortization calculator provide a more accurate amortization schedule.
  6. Add Additional Payments.
    If you plan to make extra payments towards your loan principal, input those amounts here. Extra payments can reduce the loan term and the total interest paid, which the loan amortization calculator will account for.
  7. Calculate Your Amortization Schedule.
    If you plan to make extra monthly payments, input that amount here. Extra payments can reduce the loan term and the total interest paid, which the student loan calculator will account for.
  8. Calculate Your Student Loan Payment.
    Once you have entered all the necessary details, click the “Calculate Amortization” button to see your payment schedule and total loan cost. This calculation helps you plan your finances effectively.

Loan Amortization Terms

Principal Amount

Principal amount is the total sum of money you are borrowing. This value is a key input for the loan amortization calculator.

Annual Interest Rate

Annual interest rate is the percentage charged on the principal amount each year. It is typically expressed as an annual percentage rate (APR) and determines the interest portion of your payments calculated by the loan amortization calculator.

Loan Term

Loan term is the length of time over which you agree to repay your loan. It is expressed in months and affects the payment amount, which is estimated by the loan amortization calculator.

Payment Frequency

Payment frequency is how often you make loan payments, such as monthly, bi-weekly, or weekly. Including this in the loan amortization calculator helps provide an accurate payment schedule.

Loan Start Date

Loan start date is the date when you begin making loan payments. Including this can help the loan amortization calculator provide a more precise amortization schedule.

Additional Payments

Additional payments are extra amounts you pay towards the loan principal. Including these in the loan amortization calculator helps reduce the loan term and the total interest paid.
